front.title: Router-supported Data Regeneration for In-network Storage Systems

abstract.t: In-network storage systems store redundancy to compensate for the data loss incurred by hardware failures or other reasons. This document introduces a practical work of router-supported data regeneration in in-network storage systems to maintain the amount of redundancy. This proposed regeneration process can exploit the bandwidth diversity in the network, and the corresponding protocol enables supporting routers work transparently to support the regeneration process.
